channel.title: INtech
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from INtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Meet the People Traveling the World, Thanks to Crowdfunding
item.description: To finance their travels, these people turned to the bank of friends, family, and strangers.

item.title: Google CEO Sundar Pichai announces $120M fund for global AI education
item.description: Speaking Saturday at the UN Summit of the Future, Google CEO Sundar Pichai described AI as “the most transformative technology yet” and announced a ne...

item.title: Some Mad Genius Put ChatGPT on a TI-84 Graphing Calculator
item.description: Cheaters of the world, rejoice. Although you're going to need some serious hardware skills.

item.title: X reverses course in Brazil
item.description: It seems that Elon Musk-owned social network X (formerly Twitter) is backing down from a confrontation with Brazil’s Supreme Court. The New York Times...

item.title: The 11 Best Meal Kit Delivery Services We've Tested (2024)
item.description: From Blue Apron to Dinnerly, I've spent years cooking with boxed ingredients shipped to my door.

item.title: Amazon says no to remote work
item.description: Amazon CEO Andy Jassy is calling for a full return to office at the start of 2025. For the last 15 months, employees have been expected to work in the...

item.title: The Best Smartwatches, Editor Tested and Reviewed (2024): Apple Watch, Wear OS, Hybrid Watches, Kids' Watches
item.description: These WIRED-tested wearables reduce your reliance on a phone while keeping you connected.

item.title: Qualcomm may be trying to buy Intel
item.description: Chipmaker Qualcomm is trying to buy rival Intel, according to multiple reports. The Wall Street Journal broke the news late Friday that Qualcomm had a...

item.title: 'Transformers One' Isn’t as Silly as It Looks
item.description: It’s messages may be on the nose—it’s an animated kids’ movie!—but it also has more perspective than the franchise has exhibited in years.

item.title: India’s Oyo acquires Motel 6 for $525M
item.description: One of India’s largest startups, budget hotel company Oyo, has reached a deal to acquire G6 Hospitality, which operates Motel 6. Oyo says it will pay ...
